pageTitle: HOYER: ON 13TH ANNIVERSARY OF ADA, PROMISE STILL UNFULFILLED | The Office of Democratic Whip Steny Hoyer
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {11078=“Thirteen years ago – on July 26, 1990 – our great nation made a promise to our disabled brothers and sisters that we have a moral obligation to keep.  We said no to discrimination.  We said no to sanctioned inequality.  We said yes to inclusion and equality., 11701=July 28, 2003, 8515= “For example, in 2001, the Supreme Court ruled in University of Alabama v. Garrett that state employees cannot use the ADA to win damages for on-the-job discrimination by state governments., 7281= “Next October, the Court will hear arguments in Tennessee v. Lane, a case in which it will decide whether Congress had the constitutional authority to require states to pay money damages for violations of Title II of the ADA.}
